subject: RE: [junit] help please
msgSnippet: Have you already exhausted the wealth of knowledge available online for free through Google?  If so, have you already acquired and thoroughly read any of the
messageBody:
Have you already exhausted the wealth of knowledge available online for
free through Google? If so, have you already acquired and thoroughly
read any of the several good books on JUnit? If the answer to both of
those is "yes" and you still need more on this topic, then you'll
probably need to hire a professional consultant.


Todd.

> -----Original Message-----
> From: junit@yahoogroups.com [mailto:junit@yahoogroups.com] On
> Behalf Of ahmed fouad
> Sent: Wednesday, August 31, 2005 4:32 AM
> To: junit@yahoogroups.com
> Subject: RE: [junit] help please
>
> Thank you Tood,but please I need more and more about this topic.
>
> "Bradley, Todd" <todd.bradley@...> wrote:Personally,
> I don't think it's a good idea to "re-invent the wheel", but
> of course you are doing this for the learning experience,
> which is excuseable.
>
> What you'll need for your project:
>
> OO design skills
> Java programming ability
> knowledge of unit testing techniques
> knowledge of code coverage techniques
> some Java development tools (Eclipse and ant, for instance) a
> good book on JUnit source code to JUnit and a code coverage
> tool (such as EMMA)
>
> You will hopefully not need direct involvement from ALLAH.
> If Kent Beck and Erich Gamma wrote JUnit on an airplane
> flight, I think you and your four fellow students can imitate
> it in time for graduation, without divine intervention.
>
>
> Todd.
>
>

> > From: junit@yahoogroups.com [mailto:junit@yahoogroups.com]
